second m k to front leg repeat for second sock work across front leg sts of both socks leg it s now clear sailing until ribbing cont working even around and around back legs and then front legs for 5 6 if you ve been working a st pattern across instep front leg sts you can work that st pattern on back leg as well you may need to adjust by increasing or decreasing to get the needed st count for reps of st pattern across back leg ribbed cuff when you get tired of st st or your st pattern or after 5 6 switch to 2x2 rib you may need to adjust st count for each sock to a multiple of 4 you may prefer to start rib with purls instead of knits because you may be able to pull the p st tighter between back cable and front needle so there is less chance of laddering cont 2x2 rib until socks are desired length or until you have only approx 4 5 yards of yarn remaining from each ball whichever comes first another great thing about toe-up socks is that you can truly use up all of the yarn bind off next round to ensure an ample/stretchy bobble increase each p st by purling into front and back of it this will increase total st count by 50% the edge will ruffle a bit but that will all stretch and smooth out when wearing the socks bobble loosely in rib pattern finishing weave in ends put your new socks on and prance around in them glossary common stitches & techniques for socks knitting in
